Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) from the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, faint traces of a black resinous substance on the interior, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eleven lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing part of a letter.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.101-2)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87610) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87610)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 112 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
